Dear Mrs. Turner:
I am now representing Mr. McGregor in the domestic relations case styled above.
I need from you, dates you are available next month for a deposition.
If you would be so kind to inform me the reasoning behind the email you sent to
Mr. McGregor on January 14,2025, stating o6Based off Blainets most recent email
(which Brittany was not included) unfortunatelyr l am removing myself from this
case. I wish you both the best in your journey to healing. However, I am not going
to be able to continue to assist moving forward.t'
Then in your Affidavit you provided to Ms. Gilliland's counsel who in turn
EFiled it with the Court you stated "As a professional, with 25 years of experience and
over 100 cases working with custody/divorce/alienation, this situation felt highly
manipulative and as a professionalr l realized that this process was not going to be
conducive, nor effective, and a decision was made to withdrawal".
In Court on February 13,2025, Mrs. Gilliland and her attomey Barbara Agricola
informed the Court that you were back on board and you would be willing to continue the
"reunification therapy". If this is in fact the case, I find it highly unusual that you would
withdraw on 1-13-2025 and then present an affidavit to the court on February 13,2025,
that you would not longer provide services.
I find it highly unusual that you would make such harsh statements as in your
Affidvit and then in less than twenty-four (24) hours, you were ready to start therapy
again.
I find it highly unusual that you would make such harsh statements as in your
Affidvit and then in less than twenty -fow (24) hours, you were ready to start therapy
again.
I will be looking forward to receiving the available dates in March for
depositions. I will make the necessary arrangements once the dates are received.
